title: Informal Multicultural Education Workshop for Identity Expression of Refugees and Asylum Seekers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of multicultural societies, basic artistic expression skills, and general comprehension of language education
context.additional_context: Learner Role: Students/Job Seekers. Domain Expertise: Advanced. Subject/Job Field: Language. Assessment Method: Summative Assessment-Centered. Technology Environment: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze identity expression methods of refugees and asylum seekers using performance ethnography techniques
Learners can collaboratively reconstruct others' identity narratives through visual art expressions (drawing, collage, digital art, etc.) in informal multicultural educational settings
Learners can evaluate their multicultural sensitivity levels and develop improvement plans based on peer feedback in blended learning environments

resources: Video Resources on Refugees from Diverse Cultural Backgrounds
Art Expression Tools (Sketchbook, Digital Tablet, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
